result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: OFF RECORD/ 11:02 AM Defendant Christopher M Pongratz appeared by video.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Christopher M Pongratz.  Attorney Kenneth Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Otten requests a new date, court discussion follows. Court adjourns until further notice. Parties are in discussion with JA for Trial Dates.
Motion to modify bond filed. direct attorney to contact Victim witness coordinator

records.addlTxt:
9:05 AM Defendant Christopher M Pongratz in court.  Attorney Conner Hanson (Intern) appears in court.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.  Court enters NG Plea to Count 2.  Through Attorney DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.   Attny requests DEF to appear by zoom for next hearing, Court indication once attorney is appointed, written request to be filed.  Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF. 

Attny makes bond request to amend conditions.  State opposes.  Court denies motion.  Current bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Initial appearance on August 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:14AM DEF Christopher M. Pongratz in court, appearing in person in custody.  with Atty Gabriel Pollak (special appearance as supervisor) and Conner Hanson (special appearance as intern) appearing by video.  Kenneth Sortedahl appearing by video for the State of WI.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  DEF does not qualify for public defender appointment.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Pollak/Hanson argues bond.  Court sets bond. Court gives the DEF the attorney colloquy.  Court addresses gallery for victim, no victim present.  Court has discussion with DEF on bond conditions.  DEF must appear in person for INIT.   Court sets initial appearance for 6/28/22 at 8:30AM.
